page.title: 07QUATFORD SHROPSHIRE
page.content: { Quatford}is easily accessible from Bridgnorth. The picturesque and pleasant villa residences attract the attention of many tourists. Woods surround the area of sandstone terraces covered by rich red loamy soils. There existed an old river crossing at Quatford before the town of Bridgnorth was established. The village has a{pub,}a{nursery, a {garage, two restaurants, two caravan sites and a{church,}which was consecrated 900 years ago_at the same time as the Doomesday Book was compiled. Many tourists pass through, or stop to admire this attractive village. They provide a valuable source of income for the village and are tolerated by the villagers, many of whom appear to have an old fashioned view on life.
